message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to detect semantic shifts in political and media discourse. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses neural embeddings and similarity measures, which are common techniques in machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) the second likely category. The paper also deals with metadata features and classification accuracy, which are related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and cybernetics (cs.CY), respectively. Finally, the paper deals with social and political variability, which can be related to social and information sciences (cs.SI).
